xpack.canvas.appDescription: Showcase your data in a pixel-perfect way.
xpack.canvas.argFormArgSimpleForm.requir: This argument is required, you should specify a value.
xpack.canvas.argFormSimpleFailure.failur: The interface for this argument could not parse the value, so a fallback input is being used
xpack.canvas.asset.confirmModalDetail: Are you sure you want to remove this asset?
xpack.canvas.assetModal.emptyAssetsDescr: Import your assets to get started
xpack.canvas.assetModal.filePickerPrompt: Select or drag and drop images
xpack.canvas.assetModal.modalDescription: Below are the image assets in this workpad. Any assets that are currently in use cannot be determined at this time. To reclaim space, delete assets.
xpack.canvas.customElementModal.imageFil: Select or drag and drop an image
xpack.canvas.customElementModal.imageInp: Take a screenshot of your element and upload it here. This can also be done after saving.
xpack.canvas.datasourceDatasourceCompone: The datasource has an argument controlled by an expression. Use the expression editor to modify the datasource.
xpack.canvas.datasourceDatasourcePreview: We couldn't find any documents matching your search criteria.
Check your datasource settings and try again.
The following data will be available to the selected element upon clicking {saveLabel} in the sidebar.
xpack.canvas.datasourceNoDatasource.pane: This element does not have an attached data source. This is usually because the element is an image or other static asset. If that's not the case you might want to check your expression to make sure it is not malformed.

xpack.canvas.elementConfig.failedLabel.comment: The label for the total number of elements in a workpad that have thrown an error or failed to load

xpack.canvas.elementConfig.loadedLabel.comment: The label for the number of elements in a workpad that have loaded

xpack.canvas.elementConfig.progressLabel.comment: The label for the percentage of elements that have finished loading

xpack.canvas.elementConfig.title.comment: "Elements" refers to the individual text, images, or visualizations that you can add to a Canvas workpad

xpack.canvas.elementConfig.totalLabel.comment: The label for the total number of elements in a workpad

xpack.canvas.elementSettings.dataTabLabe.comment: This tab contains the settings for the data (i.e. Elasticsearch query) used as the source for a Canvas element

xpack.canvas.elementSettings.displayTabL.comment: This tab contains the settings for how data is displayed in a Canvas element

xpack.canvas.elements.areaChartHelpText: A line chart with a filled body
xpack.canvas.elements.debugHelpText: Just dumps the configuration of the element
xpack.canvas.elements.dropdownFilterHelp: A dropdown from which you can select values for an "exactly" filter
xpack.canvas.elements.filterDebugHelpTex: Shows the underlying global filters in a workpad
xpack.canvas.elements.horizontalProgress: Displays progress as a portion of a horizontal bar
Displays progress as a portion of a horizontal pill
xpack.canvas.elements.plotHelpText: Mixed line, bar or dot charts
xpack.canvas.elements.progressGaugeHelpT: Displays progress as a portion of a gauge
xpack.canvas.elements.progressSemicircle: Displays progress as a portion of a semicircle
xpack.canvas.elements.progressWheelHelpT: Displays progress as a portion of a wheel
xpack.canvas.elements.revealImageHelpTex: Reveals a percentage of an image
xpack.canvas.elements.tableHelpText: A scrollable grid for displaying data in a tabular format
xpack.canvas.elements.verticalProgressBa: Displays progress as a portion of a vertical bar
xpack.canvas.elements.verticalProgressPi: Displays progress as a portion of a vertical pill
xpack.canvas.error.esPersist.saveFailure: Couldn't save your changes to Elasticsearch
xpack.canvas.error.esPersist.tooLargeErr: The server gave a response that the workpad data was too large. This usually means uploaded image assets that are too large for Kibana or a proxy. Try removing some assets in the asset manager.
xpack.canvas.error.repeatImage.missingMa: {maxArgument} must be set if providing an {emptyImageArgument}
xpack.canvas.error.useImportWorkpad.miss: Some properties required for a {CANVAS} workpad are missing.  Edit your {JSON} file to provide the correct property values, and try again.
xpack.canvas.error.workpadDropzone.tooMa: One one file can be uploaded at a time
xpack.canvas.errorComponent.title: Whoops! Expression failed
xpack.canvas.expressionElementNotSelecte: Select an element to show expression input
xpack.canvas.expressionTypes.argTypes.co: Tweak the appearance of the element container
xpack.canvas.expressionTypes.argTypes.fo: Set the font, size and color
xpack.canvas.expressionTypes.argTypes.se: Data has no series to style, add a color dimension
Set the style for a selected named series
xpack.canvas.functions.allHelpText: Returns {BOOLEAN_TRUE} if all of the conditions are met. See also {anyFn}.
The name of the column to alter.
The resultant column name. Leave blank to not rename.
The type to convert the column to. Leave blank to not change the type.
xpack.canvas.functions.alterColumnHelpTe: Converts between core types, including {list}, and {end}, and renames columns. See also {mapColumnFn} and {staticColumnFn}.
xpack.canvas.functions.anyHelpText: Returns {BOOLEAN_TRUE} if at least one of the conditions is met. See also {all_fn}.
xpack.canvas.functions.as.args.nameHelpT: The name to give the column.
xpack.canvas.functions.asHelpText: Creates a {DATATABLE} with a single value. See also {getCellFn}.
xpack.canvas.functions.asset.args.id: The ID of the asset to retrieve.

xpack.canvas.functions.asset.invalidAsse.comment: This error occurs when there is no asset object associated with the given ID.
xpack.canvas.functions.asset.invalidAsse.text: Could not get the asset by ID: '{assetId}'

xpack.canvas.functions.assetHelpText: Retrieves Canvas workpad asset objects to provide as argument values. Usually images.
xpack.canvas.functions.axisConfig.args.m: The maximum value displayed in the axis. Must be a number, a date in milliseconds since epoch, or an {ISO8601} string.
The minimum value displayed in the axis. Must be a number, a date in milliseconds since epoch, or an {ISO8601} string.
xpack.canvas.functions.axisConfig.args.p: The position of the axis labels. For example, {list}, or {end}.
xpack.canvas.functions.axisConfig.args.t: The increment size between each tick. Use for `number` axes only.
xpack.canvas.functions.axisConfig.invali: Invalid date string: '{max}'. 'max' must be a number, date in ms, or ISO8601 date string
Invalid date string: '{min}'. 'min' must be a number, date in ms, or ISO8601 date string
xpack.canvas.functions.axisConfigHelpTex: Configures the axis of a visualization. Only used with {plotFn}.
xpack.canvas.functions.case.args.ifHelpT: This value indicates whether the condition is met. The {IF_ARG} argument overrides the {WHEN_ARG} argument when both are provided.
xpack.canvas.functions.case.args.thenHel: The value returned if the condition is met.
xpack.canvas.functions.case.args.whenHel: The value compared to the {CONTEXT} to see if they are equal. The {WHEN_ARG} argument is ignored when the {IF_ARG} argument is also specified.
xpack.canvas.functions.caseHelpText: Builds a {case}, including a condition and a result, to pass to the {switchFn} function.
xpack.canvas.functions.columns.args.excl: A comma-separated list of column names to remove from the {DATATABLE}.
xpack.canvas.functions.columns.args.incl: A comma-separated list of column names to keep in the {DATATABLE}.
xpack.canvas.functions.columnsHelpText: Includes or excludes columns from a {DATATABLE}. When both arguments are specified, the excluded columns will be removed first.
xpack.canvas.functions.compare.args.opHe: The operator to use in the comparison: {eq} (equal to), {gt} (greater than), {gte} (greater than or equal to), {lt} (less than), {lte} (less than or equal to), {ne} or {neq} (not equal to).
xpack.canvas.functions.compareHelpText: Compares the {CONTEXT} to specified value to determine {BOOLEAN_TRUE} or {BOOLEAN_FALSE}. Usually used in combination with `{ifFn}` or `{caseFn}`. This only works with primitive types, such as {examples}. See also {eqFn}, {gtFn}, {gteFn}, {ltFn}, {lteFn}, {neqFn}
xpack.canvas.functions.containerStyle.ar: The number of pixels to use when rounding the corners.
A number between 0 and 1 that represents the degree of transparency of the element.
The distance of the content, in pixels, from the border.
xpack.canvas.functions.containerStyle.in: Invalid backgroundImage. Please provide an asset or a URL.
xpack.canvas.functions.containerStyleHel: Creates an object used for styling an element's container, including background, border, and opacity.
xpack.canvas.functions.contextHelpText: Returns whatever you pass into it. This can be useful when you need to use {CONTEXT} as argument to a function as a sub-expression.
xpack.canvas.functions.date.args.formatH: The {MOMENTJS} format used to parse the specified date string. For more information, see {url}.
xpack.canvas.functions.date.args.valueHe: An optional date string that is parsed into milliseconds since epoch. The date string can be either a valid {JS} {date} input or a string to parse using the {formatArg} argument. Must be an {ISO8601} string, or you must provide the format.
xpack.canvas.functions.dateHelpText: Returns the current time, or a time parsed from a specified string, as milliseconds since epoch.
xpack.canvas.functions.demodata.args.typ: The name of the demo data set to use.
xpack.canvas.functions.demodataHelpText: A sample data set that includes project {ci} times with usernames, countries, and run phases.
xpack.canvas.functions.do.args.fnHelpTex: The sub-expressions to execute. The return values of these sub-expressions are not available in the root pipeline as this function simply returns the original {CONTEXT}.
xpack.canvas.functions.doHelpText: Executes multiple sub-expressions, then returns the original {CONTEXT}. Use for running functions that produce an action or a side effect without changing the original {CONTEXT}.
xpack.canvas.functions.dropdownControl.a: The column or field that you want to filter.
The group name for the filter.
The column or field to use as the label in the dropdown control
The column or field from which to extract the unique values for the dropdown control.
xpack.canvas.functions.dropdownControlHe: Configures a dropdown filter control element.
xpack.canvas.functions.eqHelpText: Returns whether the {CONTEXT} is equal to the argument.
xpack.canvas.functions.escount.args.inde: An index or index pattern. For example, {example}.
xpack.canvas.functions.escountHelpText: Query {ELASTICSEARCH} for the number of hits matching the specified query.
xpack.canvas.functions.esdocs.args.count: The number of documents to retrieve. For better performance, use a smaller data set.
xpack.canvas.functions.esdocs.args.field: A comma-separated list of fields. For better performance, use fewer fields.
xpack.canvas.functions.esdocs.args.index: An index or index pattern. For example, {example}.
xpack.canvas.functions.esdocs.args.metaF: Comma separated list of meta fields. For example, {example}.
xpack.canvas.functions.esdocs.args.sortH: The sort direction formatted as {directions}. For example, {example1} or {example2}.
xpack.canvas.functions.esdocsHelpText: Query {ELASTICSEARCH} for raw documents. Specify the fields you want to retrieve, especially if you are asking for a lot of rows.
xpack.canvas.functions.essql.args.countH: The number of documents to retrieve. For better performance, use a smaller data set.
xpack.canvas.functions.essql.args.parame: A parameter to be passed to the {SQL} query.
xpack.canvas.functions.essql.args.timezo: The timezone to use for date operations. Valid {ISO8601} formats and {UTC} offsets both work.
xpack.canvas.functions.exactly.args.colu: The column or field that you want to filter.
xpack.canvas.functions.exactly.args.filt: The group name for the filter.
xpack.canvas.functions.exactly.args.valu: The value to match exactly, including white space and capitalization.
xpack.canvas.functions.exactlyHelpText: Creates a filter that matches a given column to an exact value.
xpack.canvas.functions.filterrows.args.f: An expression to pass into each row in the {DATATABLE}. The expression should return a {TYPE_BOOLEAN}. A {BOOLEAN_TRUE} value preserves the row, and a {BOOLEAN_FALSE} value removes it.
xpack.canvas.functions.filterrowsHelpTex: Filters rows in a {DATATABLE} based on the return value of a sub-expression.
xpack.canvas.functions.filters.args.grou: The name of the filter group to use.
xpack.canvas.functions.filters.args.ungr: Exclude filters that belong to a filter group?
xpack.canvas.functions.filtersHelpText: Aggregates element filters from the workpad for use elsewhere, usually a data source.
xpack.canvas.functions.formatdateHelpTex: Formats an {ISO8601} date string or a date in milliseconds since epoch using {MOMENTJS}. See {url}.
xpack.canvas.functions.formatnumber.args: A {NUMERALJS} format string. For example, {example1} or {example2}.
xpack.canvas.functions.formatnumberHelpT: Formats a number into a formatted number string using the {NUMERALJS}.
xpack.canvas.functions.getCell.args.colu: The name of the column to fetch the value from. If not provided, the value is retrieved from the first column.
xpack.canvas.functions.getCellHelpText: Fetches a single cell from a {DATATABLE}.
xpack.canvas.functions.gtHelpText: Returns whether the {CONTEXT} is greater than the argument.
xpack.canvas.functions.gteHelpText: Returns whether the {CONTEXT} is greater or equal to the argument.
xpack.canvas.functions.head.args.countHe: The number of rows to retrieve from the beginning of the {DATATABLE}.
xpack.canvas.functions.headHelpText: Retrieves the first {n} rows from the {DATATABLE}. See also {tailFn}.
xpack.canvas.functions.if.args.condition: A {BOOLEAN_TRUE} or {BOOLEAN_FALSE} indicating whether a condition is met, usually returned by a sub-expression. When unspecified, the original {CONTEXT} is returned.
xpack.canvas.functions.if.args.elseHelpT: The return value when the condition is {BOOLEAN_FALSE}. When unspecified and the condition is not met, the original {CONTEXT} is returned.
xpack.canvas.functions.if.args.thenHelpT: The return value when the condition is {BOOLEAN_TRUE}. When unspecified and the condition is met, the original {CONTEXT} is returned.
xpack.canvas.functions.image.args.dataur: The {https} {URL} or {BASE64} data {URL} of an image.
xpack.canvas.functions.image.args.modeHe: {contain} shows the entire image, scaled to fit. {cover} fills the container with the image, cropping from the sides or bottom as needed. {stretch} resizes the height and width of the image to 100% of the container.
xpack.canvas.functions.imageHelpText: Displays an image. Provide an image asset as a {BASE64} data {URL}, or pass in a sub-expression.
xpack.canvas.functions.joinRows.args.col: The column or field from which to extract the values.
xpack.canvas.functions.joinRows.args.quo: The quote character to wrap around each extracted value.
xpack.canvas.functions.joinRows.args.sep: The delimiter to insert between each extracted value.
xpack.canvas.functions.joinRowsHelpText: Concatenates values from rows in a `datatable` into a single string.
xpack.canvas.functions.locationHelpText: Find your current location using the {geolocationAPI} of the browser. Performance can vary, but is fairly accurate. See {url}. Don’t use {locationFn} if you plan to generate PDFs as this function requires user input.
xpack.canvas.functions.ltHelpText: Returns whether the {CONTEXT} is less than the argument.
xpack.canvas.functions.lteHelpText: Returns whether the {CONTEXT} is less than or equal to the argument.
xpack.canvas.functions.mapCenter.args.la: Latitude for the center of the map
xpack.canvas.functions.mapCenterHelpText: Returns an object with the center coordinates and zoom level of the map.
xpack.canvas.functions.markdown.args.con: A string of text that contains {MARKDOWN}. To concatenate, pass the {stringFn} function multiple times.
xpack.canvas.functions.markdown.args.fon: The {CSS} font properties for the content. For example, {fontFamily} or {fontWeight}.
xpack.canvas.functions.markdown.args.ope: A true or false value for opening links in a new tab. The default value is `false`. Setting to `true` opens all links in a new tab.
xpack.canvas.functions.markdownHelpText: Adds an element that renders {MARKDOWN} text. TIP: Use the {markdownFn} function for single numbers, metrics, and paragraphs of text.
xpack.canvas.functions.metric.args.label: The {CSS} font properties for the label. For example, {FONT_FAMILY} or {FONT_WEIGHT}.
The text describing the metric.
xpack.canvas.functions.metric.args.metri: The {CSS} font properties for the metric. For example, {FONT_FAMILY} or {FONT_WEIGHT}.
A {NUMERALJS} format string. For example, {example1} or {example2}.
xpack.canvas.functions.metricHelpText: Displays a number over a label.
xpack.canvas.functions.neqHelpText: Returns whether the {CONTEXT} is not equal to the argument.
xpack.canvas.functions.pie.args.fontHelp: The {CSS} font properties for the labels. For example, {FONT_FAMILY} or {FONT_WEIGHT}.
xpack.canvas.functions.pie.args.holeHelp: Draws a hole in the pie, between `0` and `100`, as a percentage of the pie radius.
xpack.canvas.functions.pie.args.labelRad: The percentage of the container area to use as a radius for the label circle.
xpack.canvas.functions.pie.args.legendHe: The legend position. For example, {legend}, or {BOOLEAN_FALSE}. When {BOOLEAN_FALSE}, the legend is hidden.
xpack.canvas.functions.pie.args.paletteH: A {palette} object for describing the colors to use in this pie chart.
xpack.canvas.functions.pie.args.radiusHe: The radius of the pie as a percentage, between `0` and `1`, of the available space. To automatically set the radius, use {auto}.
xpack.canvas.functions.pie.args.seriesSt: A style of a specific series
xpack.canvas.functions.pie.args.tiltHelp: The percentage of tilt where `1` is fully vertical, and `0` is completely flat.
xpack.canvas.functions.plot.args.default: The default style to use for every series.
xpack.canvas.functions.plot.args.fontHel: The {CSS} font properties for the labels. For example, {FONT_FAMILY} or {FONT_WEIGHT}.
xpack.canvas.functions.plot.args.legendH: The legend position. For example, {legend}, or {BOOLEAN_FALSE}. When {BOOLEAN_FALSE}, the legend is hidden.
xpack.canvas.functions.plot.args.palette: A {palette} object for describing the colors to use in this chart.
xpack.canvas.functions.plot.args.seriesS: A style of a specific series
xpack.canvas.functions.plot.args.xaxisHe: The axis configuration. When {BOOLEAN_FALSE}, the axis is hidden.
xpack.canvas.functions.plot.args.yaxisHe: The axis configuration. When {BOOLEAN_FALSE}, the axis is hidden.
xpack.canvas.functions.ply.args.expressi: An expression to pass each resulting {DATATABLE} into. Tips: Expressions must return a {DATATABLE}. Use {asFn} to turn literals into {DATATABLE}s. Multiple expressions must return the same number of rows.If you need to return a different row count, pipe into another instance of {plyFn}. If multiple expressions returns the columns with the same name, the last one wins.
xpack.canvas.functions.ply.rowCountMisma: All expressions must return the same number of rows
xpack.canvas.functions.plyHelpText: Subdivides a {DATATABLE} by the unique values of the specified columns, and passes the resulting tables into an expression, then merges the outputs of each expression.
An expression to use in determining the mark's color.
The size of the marks. Only applicable to supported elements.
The text to show on the mark. Only applicable to supported elements.
xpack.canvas.functions.pointseries.unwra: Expressions must be wrapped in a function such as {fn}
xpack.canvas.functions.pointseriesHelpTe: Turn a {DATATABLE} into a point series model. Currently we differentiate measure from dimensions by looking for a {TINYMATH} expression. See {TINYMATH_URL}. If you enter a {TINYMATH} expression in your argument, we treat that argument as a measure, otherwise it is a dimension. Dimensions are combined to create unique keys. Measures are then deduplicated by those keys using the specified {TINYMATH} function
xpack.canvas.functions.progress.args.bar: The color of the background bar.
The thickness of the background bar.
xpack.canvas.functions.progress.args.fon: The {CSS} font properties for the label. For example, {FONT_FAMILY} or {FONT_WEIGHT}.
xpack.canvas.functions.progress.args.lab: To show or hide the label, use {BOOLEAN_TRUE} or {BOOLEAN_FALSE}. Alternatively, provide a string to display as a label.
xpack.canvas.functions.progress.args.max: The maximum value of the progress element.
xpack.canvas.functions.progress.args.val: The color of the progress bar.
The thickness of the progress bar.
xpack.canvas.functions.progress.invalidM: Invalid {arg} value: '{max, number}'. '{arg}' must be greater than 0
xpack.canvas.functions.progress.invalidV: Invalid value: '{value, number}'. Value must be between 0 and {max, number}
xpack.canvas.functions.render.args.asHel: The element type to render. You probably want a specialized function instead, such as {plotFn} or {shapeFn}.
xpack.canvas.functions.render.args.conta: The style for the container, including background, border, and opacity.
xpack.canvas.functions.render.args.cssHe: Any block of custom {CSS} to be scoped to the element.
xpack.canvas.functions.renderHelpText: Renders the {CONTEXT} as a specific element and sets element level options, such as background and border styling.
Fills the difference between the {CONTEXT} and {maxArg} parameter for the element with this image. Provide an image asset as a {BASE64} data {URL}, or pass in a sub-expression.
The image to repeat. Provide an image asset as a {BASE64} data {URL}, or pass in a sub-expression.
The maximum number of times the image can repeat.
The maximum height or width of the image, in pixels. When the image is taller than it is wide, this function limits the height.
xpack.canvas.functions.replace.args.patt: The text or pattern of a {JS} regular expression. For example, {example}. You can use capturing groups here.
xpack.canvas.functions.replace.args.repl: The replacement for the matching parts of string. Capturing groups can be accessed by their index. For example, {example}.
xpack.canvas.functions.replaceImageHelpT: Uses a regular expression to replace parts of a string.
An optional background image to reveal over. Provide an image asset as a `{BASE64}` data {URL}, or pass in a sub-expression.
The image to reveal. Provide an image asset as a {BASE64} data {URL}, or pass in a sub-expression.
The position to start the image fill. For example, {list}, or {end}.
xpack.canvas.functions.revealImage.inval: Invalid value: '{percent}'. Percentage must be between 0 and 1
xpack.canvas.functions.rounddate.args.fo: The {MOMENTJS} format to use for bucketing. For example, {example} rounds to months. See {url}.
xpack.canvas.functions.rounddateHelpText: Uses a {MOMENTJS} formatting string to round milliseconds since epoch, and returns milliseconds since epoch.
xpack.canvas.functions.rowCountHelpText: Returns the number of rows. Pairs with {plyFn} to get the count of unique column values, or combinations of unique column values.
xpack.canvas.functions.savedLens.args.id: The ID of the saved Lens visualization object
xpack.canvas.functions.savedLens.args.pa: The palette used for the Lens visualization
xpack.canvas.functions.savedLens.args.ti: The timerange of data that should be included
The title for the Lens visualization object
xpack.canvas.functions.savedLensHelpText: Returns an embeddable for a saved Lens visualization object.
xpack.canvas.functions.savedMap.args.cen: The center and zoom level the map should have
xpack.canvas.functions.savedMap.args.hid: The IDs of map layers that should be hidden
xpack.canvas.functions.savedMap.args.idH: The ID of the saved map object
xpack.canvas.functions.savedMap.args.lon: Longitude for the center of the map
xpack.canvas.functions.savedMap.args.tim: The timerange of data that should be included
xpack.canvas.functions.savedMapHelpText: Returns an embeddable for a saved map object.
xpack.canvas.functions.savedSearchHelpTe: Returns an embeddable for a saved search object
xpack.canvas.functions.savedVisualizatio: Defines the color to use for a specific series
Specifies the option to hide the legend
The ID of the saved visualization object
The timerange of data that should be included
The title for the visualization object
Returns an embeddable for a saved visualization object.
Should we fill in the points?
Sets the orientation of the bars in the chart to horizontal.
The name of the series to style.
The size of points on line.
Specifies if the series should be stacked. The number is the stack ID. Series with the same stack ID are stacked together.
xpack.canvas.functions.seriesStyleHelpTe: Creates an object used for describing the properties of a series on a chart. Use {seriesStyleFn} inside of a charting function, like {plotFn} or {pieFn}.
xpack.canvas.functions.shape.args.border: An {SVG} color for the border outlining the shape.
xpack.canvas.functions.shape.args.fillHe: An {SVG} color to fill the shape.
xpack.canvas.functions.shape.args.mainta: Maintain the shape's original aspect ratio?
xpack.canvas.functions.sort.args.byHelpT: The column to sort by. When unspecified, the {DATATABLE} is sorted by the first column.
xpack.canvas.functions.sort.args.reverse: Reverses the sorting order. When unspecified, the {DATATABLE} is sorted in ascending order.
xpack.canvas.functions.sortHelpText: Sorts a {DATATABLE} by the specified column.
xpack.canvas.functions.staticColumn.args: The name of the new column.
The value to insert in each row in the new column. TIP: use a sub-expression to rollup other columns into a static value.
xpack.canvas.functions.staticColumnHelpT: Adds a column with the same static value in every row. See also {alterColumnFn} and {mapColumnFn}.
xpack.canvas.functions.string.args.value: The values to join together into one string. Include spaces where needed.
xpack.canvas.functions.stringHelpText: Concatenates all of the arguments into a single string.
xpack.canvas.functions.switch.args.defau: The value returned when no conditions are met. When unspecified and no conditions are met, the original {CONTEXT} is returned.
xpack.canvas.functions.switchHelpText: Performs conditional logic with multiple conditions. See also {caseFn}, which builds a {case} to pass to the {switchFn} function.
xpack.canvas.functions.table.args.fontHe: The {CSS} font properties for the contents of the table. For example, {FONT_FAMILY} or {FONT_WEIGHT}.
xpack.canvas.functions.table.args.pagina: Show pagination controls? When {BOOLEAN_FALSE}, only the first page is displayed.
xpack.canvas.functions.table.args.perPag: The number of rows to display on each page.
xpack.canvas.functions.table.args.showHe: Show or hide the header row with titles for each column.
xpack.canvas.functions.tail.args.countHe: The number of rows to retrieve from the end of the {DATATABLE}.
xpack.canvas.functions.tailHelpText: Retrieves the last N rows from the end of a {DATATABLE}. See also {headFn}.
xpack.canvas.functions.timefilter.args.c: The column or field that you want to filter.
xpack.canvas.functions.timefilter.args.f: The group name for the filter.
The beginning of the range, in {ISO8601} or {ELASTICSEARCH} {DATEMATH} format
xpack.canvas.functions.timefilter.args.t: The end of the range, in {ISO8601} or {ELASTICSEARCH} {DATEMATH} format
xpack.canvas.functions.timefilterControl: The column or field that you want to filter.
Shows the time filter as a button, which triggers a popover.
Configures a time filter control element.
xpack.canvas.functions.timefilterHelpTex: Creates a time filter for querying a source.
xpack.canvas.functions.timelion.args.fro: The {ELASTICSEARCH} {DATEMATH} string for the beginning of the time range.
xpack.canvas.functions.timelion.args.int: The bucket interval for the time series.
xpack.canvas.functions.timelion.args.tim: The timezone for the time range. See {MOMENTJS_TIMEZONE_URL}.
xpack.canvas.functions.timelion.args.to: The {ELASTICSEARCH} {DATEMATH} string for the end of the time range.
xpack.canvas.functions.timelionHelpText: Uses Timelion to extract one or more time series from many sources.
xpack.canvas.functions.timerange.args.fr: The start of the time range
xpack.canvas.functions.timerange.args.to: The end of the time range
xpack.canvas.functions.timerangeHelpText: An object that represents a span of time.
xpack.canvas.functions.to.args.type: A known data type in the expression language.
xpack.canvas.functions.toHelpText: Explicitly casts the type of the {CONTEXT} from one type to the specified type.
xpack.canvas.functions.urlparam.args.def: The string returned when the {URL} parameter is unspecified.
xpack.canvas.functions.urlparamHelpText: Retrieves a {URL} parameter to use in an expression. The {urlparamFn} function always returns a {TYPE_STRING}. For example, you can retrieve the value {value} from the parameter {myVar} from the {URL} {example}.
xpack.canvas.groupSettings.multipleEleme: Deselect these elements to edit their individual settings, press ({gKey}) to group them, or save this selection as a new element to re-use it throughout your workpad.
xpack.canvas.groupSettings.saveGroupDesc: Save this group as a new element to re-use it throughout your workpad.
xpack.canvas.groupSettings.ungroupDescri: Ungroup ({uKey}) to edit individual element settings.

xpack.canvas.home.workpadTemplatesTabLab.comment: The label for the tab that displays a list of designed workpad templates.

xpack.canvas.homeEmptyPrompt.emptyPrompt: Create a new workpad, start from a template, or import a workpad {JSON} file by dropping it here.
xpack.canvas.keyboardShortcuts.ignoreSna: Move, resize, and rotate without snapping

xpack.canvas.keyboardShortcutsDoc.shortc.comment: Separates which keyboard shortcuts can be used for a single action. Example: "{shortcut1} or {shortcut2} or {shortcut3}"

xpack.canvas.labs.enableLabsDescription: This flag determines if the viewer has access to the Labs button, a quick way to enable and disable experimental features in Canvas.
xpack.canvas.pageConfig.backgroundColorD: Accepts HEX, RGB or HTML color names
xpack.canvas.pageConfig.title: Page settings

xpack.canvas.pageConfig.transitionLabel.comment: This refers to the transition effect, such as fade in or rotate,  applied to a page in presentation mode.

xpack.canvas.pageConfig.transitionPrevie.comment: This is the label for a preview of the transition effect selected.

xpack.canvas.pageConfig.transitions.none.comment: This is the option the user should choose if they do not want any page transition (i.e. fade in, fade out, etc) to be applied to the current page.

xpack.canvas.pageManager.addPageTooltip: Add a new page to this workpad
xpack.canvas.pageManager.confirmRemoveDe: Are you sure you want to remove this page?

xpack.canvas.renderer.advancedFilter.app.comment: This refers to applying the filter to the Canvas workpad

xpack.canvas.renderer.dropdownFilter.hel: A dropdown from which you can select values for an "{exactly}" filter

xpack.canvas.renderer.dropdownFilter.mat.comment: The dropdown filter option to match any value in the field.

xpack.canvas.renderer.embeddable.helpDes: Renders an embeddable Saved Object from other parts of Kibana
xpack.canvas.renderer.error.helpDescript: Render error data in a way that is helpful to users
xpack.canvas.renderer.metric.helpDescrip: Render a number over a label
xpack.canvas.renderer.pie.helpDescriptio: Render a pie chart from data
xpack.canvas.renderer.plot.helpDescripti: Render an XY plot from your data
xpack.canvas.renderer.progress.helpDescr: Render a progress indicator that reveals a percentage of an element
xpack.canvas.renderer.repeatImage.helpDe: Repeat an image a given number of times
xpack.canvas.renderer.revealImage.helpDe: Reveal a percentage of an image to make a custom gauge-style chart
xpack.canvas.renderer.timeFilter.helpDes: Set a time window to filter your data
xpack.canvas.savedElementsModal.addNewEl: Group and save workpad elements to create new elements
xpack.canvas.savedElementsModal.deleteEl: Are you sure you want to delete this element?
xpack.canvas.shareWebsiteFlyout.descript: Follow these steps to share a static version of this workpad on an external website. It will be a visual snapshot of the current workpad, and will not have access to live data.
xpack.canvas.shareWebsiteFlyout.flyoutCa: To try sharing, you can {link} containing this workpad, the {CANVAS} Shareable Workpad runtime, and a sample {HTML} file.
xpack.canvas.shareWebsiteFlyout.runtimeS: In order to render a Shareable Workpad, you also need to include the {CANVAS} Shareable Workpad Runtime. You can skip this step if the runtime is already included on your website.
xpack.canvas.shareWebsiteFlyout.snippets: Should the runtime automatically move through the pages of the workpad?

The Workpad is placed within the {HTML} of the site by using an {HTML} placeholder. Parameters for the runtime are included inline. See the full list of parameters below. You can include more than one workpad on the page.
The height of the Workpad. Defaults to the Workpad height.
The interval upon which the pages will advance in time format, (e.g. {twoSeconds}, {oneMinute})
The page to display. Defaults to the page specified by the Workpad.
There are a number of inline parameters to configure the Shareable Workpad.
The type of shareable. In this case, a {CANVAS} Workpad.
The {URL} of the Shareable Workpad {JSON} file.
The width of the Workpad. Defaults to the Workpad width.
xpack.canvas.shareWebsiteFlyout.workpadS: The workpad will be exported as a single {JSON} file for sharing in another site.

xpack.canvas.sidebarContent.groupedEleme.comment: The title displayed when a grouped element is selected. "elements" refer to the different visualizations, images, text, etc that can be added in a Canvas workpad. These elements can be grouped into a larger "grouped element" that contains multiple individual elements.

xpack.canvas.sidebarContent.multiElement.comment: The title displayed when multiple elements are selected. "elements" refer to the different visualizations, images, text, etc that can be added in a Canvas workpad.

xpack.canvas.sidebarContent.singleElemen.comment: The title displayed when a single element are selected. "element" refer to the different visualizations, images, text, etc that can be added in a Canvas workpad.

xpack.canvas.transitions.fade.help: Fade from one page to the next
xpack.canvas.transitions.rotate.help: Rotate from one page to the next
xpack.canvas.transitions.slide.help: Slide from one page to the next
xpack.canvas.transitions.zoom.help: Zoom from one page to the next
xpack.canvas.uis.arguments.axisConfigDis: Switch on to view axis settings
xpack.canvas.uis.arguments.filterGroupLa: Create or select a filter group
xpack.canvas.uis.arguments.imageUpload.f: Select or drag and drop an image
xpack.canvas.uis.arguments.numberFormatL: Select or enter a valid {numeralJS} format
xpack.canvas.uis.arguments.paletteLabel: The collection of colors used to render the element
xpack.canvas.uis.arguments.rangeLabel: Slider for values within a range
xpack.canvas.uis.arguments.selectLabel: Select from multiple options in a drop down
xpack.canvas.uis.arguments.shapeLabel: Change the shape of the current element
xpack.canvas.uis.dataSources.demoData.he: This element is using demo data
xpack.canvas.uis.dataSources.demoDataDes: By default, every {canvas} element is connected to the demo data source. Change the data source, above, to connect your own data.
xpack.canvas.uis.dataSources.demoDataLab: Sample data set used to populate default elements
xpack.canvas.uis.dataSources.esdocs.fiel: This datasource performs best with 10 or fewer fields
xpack.canvas.uis.dataSources.esdocs.inde: Enter an index name or select an index pattern
xpack.canvas.uis.dataSources.esdocs.warn: Using this data source with larger data sets can result in slower performance. Use this source only when you need exact values.
xpack.canvas.uis.dataSources.esdocsLabel: Pull data directly from {elasticsearch} without the use of aggregations
xpack.canvas.uis.dataSources.essqlLabel: Write an {elasticsearch} {sql} query to retrieve data
xpack.canvas.uis.dataSources.timelion.ab: Use {timelion} syntax in {canvas} to retrieve timeseries data
xpack.canvas.uis.dataSources.timelion.ti: Some {timelion} functions, such as {functionExample}, do not translate to a {canvas} data table. However, anything todo with data manipulation should work as expected.
{timelion} requires a time range. Add a time filter element to your page or use the expression editor to pass one in.
xpack.canvas.uis.dataSources.timelionLab: Use {timelion} syntax to retrieve timeseries data
xpack.canvas.uis.models.math.args.valueL: Function and column to use in extracting a value from the datasource
xpack.canvas.uis.models.pointSeries.args: Determines the color of a mark or series
Determine the size of a mark
Set the text to use as, or around, the mark
Data along the horizontal axis. Usually a number, string or date
Data along the vertical axis. Usually a number
xpack.canvas.uis.transforms.roundDate.ar: Select or enter a {momentJs} format to round the date
xpack.canvas.uis.views.dropdownControl.a: Column to which the value selected from the dropdown is applied
Apply the selected group name to an element's filters function to target this filter
Column from which to extract values to make available in the dropdown
xpack.canvas.uis.views.getCellLabel: Grab the first row and first column
xpack.canvas.uis.views.image.args.modeLa: Note: Stretched fill may not work with vector images
xpack.canvas.uis.views.metric.args.label: Enter a text label for the metric value
Label
Fonts, alignment and color
Label text
xpack.canvas.uis.views.metric.args.metri: Select a format for the metric value
xpack.canvas.uis.views.openLinksInNewTab: Set links to open in new tab
Open all links in a new tab
xpack.canvas.uis.views.pie.args.labelRad: Distance of the labels from the center of the pie
xpack.canvas.uis.views.pie.args.tiltLabe: Percentage of tilt where 100 is fully vertical and 0 is completely flat
xpack.canvas.uis.views.plot.args.default: Set the style to be used by default by every series, unless overridden
xpack.canvas.uis.views.progress.args.bar: Accepts HEX, RGB or HTML color names
xpack.canvas.uis.views.progress.args.fon: Font settings for the label. Technically, you can add other styles as well
xpack.canvas.uis.views.progress.args.lab: Set {true}/{false} to show/hide label or provide a string to display as the label
xpack.canvas.uis.views.progress.args.max: Maximum value of the progress element
xpack.canvas.uis.views.render.args.cssLa: A {css} stylesheet scoped to your element
xpack.canvas.uis.views.renderLabel: Setting for the container around your element
An image to fill up the difference between the value and the max count
The maximum number of repeated images
The size of the largest dimension of the image. Eg, if the image is tall but not wide, this is the height
A background image. Eg, an empty glass
An image to reveal given the function input. Eg, a full glass
The direction from which to start the reveal
xpack.canvas.uis.views.shape.args.border: Accepts HEX, RGB or HTML color names
xpack.canvas.uis.views.shape.args.fillLa: Accepts HEX, RGB or HTML color names
xpack.canvas.uis.views.table.args.pagina: Show or hide pagination controls. If disabled only the first page will be shown
xpack.canvas.uis.views.table.args.perPag: Number of rows to display per table page
xpack.canvas.uis.views.table.args.showHe: Show or hide the header row with titles for each column
xpack.canvas.uis.views.tableLabel: Set styling for a Table element
xpack.canvas.uis.views.timefilter.args.c: Column to which selected time is applied
xpack.canvas.uis.views.timefilter.args.f: Apply the selected group name to an element's filters function to target this filter

xpack.canvas.useCloneWorkpad.clonedWorkp.comment: This suffix is added to the end of the name of a cloned workpad to indicate that this new workpad is a copy of the original workpad. Example: "Copy of Sales Pitch"

xpack.canvas.varConfig.emptyDescription: This workpad has no variables currently. You may add variables to store and edit common values. These variables can then be used in elements or within the expression editor.
xpack.canvas.varConfig.titleTooltip: Add variables to store and edit common values
xpack.canvas.varConfigDeleteVar.warningD: Deleting this variable may adversely affect the workpad. Are you sure you wish to continue?
xpack.canvas.varConfigEditVar.editWarnin: Editing a variable in use may adversely affect your workpad

xpack.canvas.workpadConfig.USLetterButto.comment: This is referring to the dimensions of U.S. standard letter paper.

xpack.canvas.workpadConfig.applyStyleshe.comment: "stylesheet" refers to the collection of CSS style rules entered by the user.

xpack.canvas.workpadConfig.globalCSSTool: Apply styles to all pages in this workpad
xpack.canvas.workpadConfig.swapDimension: Swap the page's width and height
xpack.canvas.workpadConfig.title: Workpad settings
xpack.canvas.workpadHeader.noWritePermis: You don't have permission to edit this workpad

xpack.canvas.workpadHeaderEditMenu.align.comment: This refers to the vertical (i.e. left, center, right) and horizontal (i.e. top, middle, bottom) alignment options of the selected elements

xpack.canvas.workpadHeaderEditMenu.cente.comment: This refers to alignment centered horizontally.

xpack.canvas.workpadHeaderEditMenu.distr.comment: This refers to the options to evenly spacing the selected elements horizontall or vertically.

xpack.canvas.workpadHeaderEditMenu.group.comment: This refers to grouping multiple selected elements.

xpack.canvas.workpadHeaderEditMenu.middl.comment: This refers to alignment centered vertically.

xpack.canvas.workpadHeaderEditMenu.order.comment: Refers to the order of the elements displayed on the page from front to back

xpack.canvas.workpadHeaderEditMenu.ungro.comment: This refers to ungrouping a grouped element

xpack.canvas.workpadHeaderShareMenu.shar: Failed to create {ZIP} file for '{workpadName}'. The workpad may be too large. You'll need to download the files separately.
xpack.canvas.workpadHeaderShareMenu.unsu: This workpad contains render functions that are not supported by the {CANVAS} Shareable Workpad Runtime. These elements will not be rendered:
xpack.canvas.workpadTable.noPermissionTo: You don't have permission to clone workpads

xpack.canvas.workpadTable.table.actionsC.comment: This column in the table contains the actions that can be taken on a workpad.

xpack.canvas.workpadTable.table.createdC.comment: This column in the table contains the date/time the workpad was created.

xpack.canvas.workpadTable.table.updatedC.comment: This column in the table contains the date/time the workpad was last updated.

xpack.canvas.workpadTableTools.noPermiss: You don't have permission to create workpads
You don't have permission to delete workpads
You don't have permission to upload workpads
xpack.canvas.workpadTemplates.table.name: Template name

xpack.canvas.workpadTemplates.table.tags.comment: This column contains relevant tags that indicate what type of template is displayed. For example: "report", "presentation", etc.
